title: RFI: Attractive Valuation In Anticipation Of Lower Rates (NYSE:RFI)
description: RFI provides 8% yield and diversified real estate exposure, outperforming REIT ETFs despite rate headwinds, with some dividend risk. See why RFI CEF is a buy.
content:
Financial analyst by day and a seasoned investor by passion, I've been involved in the world of investing for over 15 years and honed my skills in analyzing lucrative opportunities within the market.I specialize in uncovering high quality dividend stocks and other assets that offer potential for long term-growth that pack a serious punch for bill-paying potential. I use myself as an example that with a solid base of classic dividend growth stocks, sprinkling in some Business Development Companies, REITs, and Closed End Funds can be a highly efficient way to boost your investment income while still capturing a total return that follows traditional index funds. I created a hybrid system between growth and income and manage to still capture a total return that is on par with the S&P.

summary: Financial analyst by day and a passionate investor, Michael K. Smith, has been involved in investing for over 15 years and specializes in uncovering high-quality dividend stocks and assets that offer potential for long-term growth. Smith argues that combining these assets with traditional dividend growth stocks and some business development companies can boost investment income while capturing a total return that follows traditional index funds. Smith believes that combining the growth and income can be a successful strategy for investors. Smith also notes that past performance is no guarantee for future success.
